messages: bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (02:25): omg ufat.dll

30c0f486a35ace88d39489f7dd46a746 (02:27): * use ConsoleInfo struct directly
30c0f486a35ace88d39489f7dd46a746 (02:27): * change type in global struct (avoid buffer overflow when reading value from registry)
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:27): encoded, now, if format.exe was working, i would be able to add support for fatx (xbox) in format.exe in a few minutes
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (02:28): i sea...
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:30): on my machine reactos-0.3.0-REL doesn't boot, neither live-cd nor install-cd, is there any doc for build system from scratch?
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:31): Collibri, sure. windows or linux?
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (02:31): why does it not boot?
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:32): I need a basic system first
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:32): encoded, boot hangs at keyboard-setup
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:32): Collibri, http://www.reactos.org/wiki/index.php/HOWTO#Development
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:32): as long as i can see in bochs
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:34): i don't want to build a system, i want to install binaries by hand
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:36): Collibri, what do you call the "keyboard-setup"?
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:36): the one on blue background in text mode where you choose resolution, keyboard...
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:36): or the one in graphic mode in a wizard?
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:37): i call nothing, bochs tell me reactos is sending some bytes to keyboard, setup is still in text mode
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:37): blue background
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:38): probably to detect the keyboard
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:38): i suppose so
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:38): Collibri, you can try qemu, it's faster and it works well
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (02:38): or vmware
bddd707e7488c05ab5d30ddb4baa2518 (02:38): its even more faster
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:39): yes, but the source code is not available, which doesn't please some people :)
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:39): okay, thanks (but qemu needs a glibc-update)
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:40): bochs is too slow. you're maybe the first one to test with it
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:40): btw, our keyboard detection routine has some bugs, and you probably encounter one
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:40): someone is the first
3dd0267c676205e608567673d6d0cec9 (02:41): did anyone notice http://svn.reactos.ru/svn/reactos/trunk/reactos/include/reactos/drivers/drivers/
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:42): is it recommended to add one more bugzilla entry for keyboard problems
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:43): Collibri, yes, if you explicitly specify that you use BOCHS (ie means a reproductable environment)
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:44): i used bochs to find the reason of no-booting only (it's very slow)
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:45): on real hardware it seems to be the same problem
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:46): Collibri, unfortunately, depends of the keyboard... works on most computers, not on others
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:46): and all my 3 computers work, so i can't do anything
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:46): i have a cherry-ps2 keyboard - no special one :-)
9d285d46b2c0e0aa048cf3596b841569 (02:49): we need more girl like IDA ;)
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:49): btw. are there any thoughts about using of gettext (or similiar) instead of hardcoded text
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:50): not easy to answer in less than 1 minute to Collibri...
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:52): its easier for translators - translate just one text file for all os-related things
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (02:53): what module are you in that has hardcoded text?
e5e87095208eeadd9c5d52cd55e2ed98 (02:53): most of them have it moved out to .rc files already
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:53): okay, but gettext is more flexible and preserve a fall-back-language
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:54): .rc files too. ENGLISH/US is the fall back language
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:55): in short: no gettext
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (02:55): .rc files work well (and call contain other things than strings, like icons, images...), so no need to use another thing
9d285d46b2c0e0aa048cf3596b841569 (02:58): and the api for them is defined, used by many (all?) apps so why not use it in reactos too
30c0f486a35ace88d39489f7dd46a746 (02:58): 03hpoussin * r23919 10reactos/dll/win32/fmifs/format.c: Add a hack to enable formatting (was broken since at least r20156)
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (02:59): it was an idea only .oO(if you need to swap the order of args in a translation you will get problems with rc-files)
9d285d46b2c0e0aa048cf3596b841569 (03:00): i dunno much about rc, but i think if it works for microsoft it'll work for ros too
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:01): don't printf and friends allow you to permute the args in a format string?
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (03:01): i dunno much about gettext, but what if you change the original translation (probably the english one)? you need to update all others as well?
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (03:01): you don't want to be better than microsoft? ;-)
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:01): hpoussin: yeah, gettext does have that problem...
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (03:01): SamB, that's what i thought :)
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:02): at least, if you change the source code instead of writing a new translation from source to english...
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:02): dunno if you can do that or not ;-)
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:02): I suppose you probably can
99b3de46135082c6f99f26ced7d4c248 (03:03): SamB, so, you end up with broken english in source and correct english in another place...
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (03:03): okay, but all english texts are extracted from source automatically
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:03): hpoussin: well, I never said I liked gettext ;-)
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:03): or at least, not lately
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:03): and if I ever did I was silly to do so without knowing how to use it...
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:04): or having used it...
ce4cb0f56a7080f7e37881760c79fffb (03:07): the keyboard problem is this component "Kernel" or "Setup" (Bugzilla)
d0c44a952ebaa6c33871cf8b7e05fedb (03:07): I think I kinda like the windows way, except having to come up with a number seems a bit bothersome...
1cce3679f9e04ea923df2802a2b53dbf (03:11): 0xC0000033 is STATUS_OBJECT_NAME_INVALID
1cce3679f9e04ea923df2802a2b53dbf (03:13): 0xC0000034 is STATUS_OBJECT_NAME_NOT_FOUND
